description: This course focuses on tarot, a collection of cards used for multiple, unique purposes. The course
discusses the origins and history of tarot, as well as examines the controversies surrounding the
Rider Waite Smith deck. Using literary and cultural analysis, students will examine current
iterations of tarot in literature and pop culture. Students will learn how to conduct tarot
readings for themselves and others. Offered periodically. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
